Race.SpecificTitle: PW City-Parish Council (Airport) -- 1.71 Mill -  PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
(Airport Tax)
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  Authority for the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana, to continue to levy a 10-year 1.71-mill property tax for improving, maintaining and operating the Lafayette Regional Airport.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of one and seventy-one hundredths (1.71) mills on all property subject to taxation in said Parish, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022 (an estimated $2,810,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of improving, maintaining and operating the Lafayette Regional Airport?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW City-Parish Council (Drainage) -- 3.34 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
(Drainage Tax)
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  Authority for the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana, to continue to levy a 10 year 3.34 mills property tax for maintaining, operating and improving drainage works.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of three and thirty-four hundredths (3.34) mills on all property subject to taxation in said Parish, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022 (an estimated $5,490,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of maintaining, operating and improving drainage works within and for said Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW City-Parish Council (Library) -- 2 Mill - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Propositions
(Library Tax)
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  Authority for the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana, to continue to levy a 10-year 2-mill property tax for constructing, improving, maintaining and operating public libraries in the Parish, including the acquisition of equipment, books, materials and supplies.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy and collect a two (2) mills tax on all property subject to taxation within the Parish for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022 (an estimated $3,280,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of constructing, improving, maintaining and operating public libraries in the Parish, including the acquisition of equipment, books, materials and supplies?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Cons. School Dist. #1 -- 16.7 Mills - SB - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Consolidated School District No. 1)
(Maintenance Tax Renewal)

Summary:  Authority to continue to levy a 10 year 16.7 mills property tax for the purpose of giving additional support to public elementary and secondary schools, excluding capital improvements.
Race.FullText: Shall Consolidated School District No. 1 of the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana, continue to levy a sixteen and seven-tenths (16.7) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in said Consolidated School District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2015 and ending with the year 2024 (an estimated $27,450,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for the purpose of giving additional support to public elementary and secondary schools, excluding capital improvements in said Consolidated School District?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Lafayette (Fire) -- 2 Mill - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Lafayette Propositions
(Fire Millage Renewal)

Summary:  Authority for the City of Lafayette to continue to levy a 10-year 2-mill property tax for paying the costs of providing fire salaries and salary related benefits in said City.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "City"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of two (2) mills on all property subject to taxation in said City, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022 (an estimated $2,430,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of paying the costs of providing fire salaries and salary related benefits in said City?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Lafayette (Police) -- 3 Mill - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Lafayette Propositions
(Police Millage Renewal)

Summary:  Authority for the City of Lafayette to continue to levy a 10-year 3-mill property tax for paying the costs of providing police salaries and salary related benefits in said City.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "City"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of three (3) mills on all property subject to taxation in said City, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022 (an estimated $3,650,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of paying the costs of providing police salaries and salary related benefits in said City?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Youngsville -- 1% S&U - Mayor & CC - 2 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Youngsville Proposition
(1% Sales and Use Tax Rededication)

Summary:  Authority to rededicate the proceeds of a 1% sales and use tax authorized at an election held on July 11, 1981 for various purposes.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Youngsville, State of Louisiana (the "City") be authorized to rededicate the revenues received from the levy and collection of a one percent (1%) sales and use tax (the "1981 Tax") previously authorized at an election held on July 11, 1981 (an estimated $1,500,000 expected to be collected from the levy of the 1981 Tax for an entire year) so that beginning January 1, 2013, and for a period of two (2) years thereafter, 50% of the revenues of the 1981 Tax received by the City during such period may be used to pay the costs of operating and maintaining law enforcement facilities, acquiring equipment and furnishings therefore, constructing and/or acquiring buildings  to house such facilities and paying police department employee salaries and benefits; and 50% of the revenues of the 1981 Tax received by the City during such period may be used to pay the costs of operating and maintaining law enforcement facilities, acquiring equipment and furnishings therefore, constructing and acquiring buildings to house such facilities and paying police department employee salaries and benefits; constructing, improving and maintaining works of public improvement and acquiring equipment therefore; constructing, acquiring, operating and maintaining fire protection facilities and acquiring equipment and furnishings therefore and paying fire department employee salaries and benefits, and beginning January 1, 2015 and thereafter, all of the revenues of the 1981 Tax received by the City shall revert back to the Police Department and may be used to pay the costs of operating and maintaining law enforcement facilities, acquiring equipment and furnishings therefor, constructing and/or acquiring buildings to house such facilities and paying police department employees' salaries and benefits all within the Youngsville Police Department?
